thread.title: Bournemouth vs Man City LIVE score, goal updates, team news and TV information
thread.title_full: Bournemouth vs Man City LIVE score, goal updates, team news and TV information

author: James Robson
title: Bournemouth vs Man City LIVE score, goal updates, team news and TV information
text:
Bournemouth vs Man City LIVE score, goal updates, team news and TV information Updates from the Vitality Stadium as Pep Guardiola's Manchester City side take on Bournemouth Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now City v Bournemouth: Match Preview Share this video Watch Next 
Manchester City can move up to second in the Premier League if they defeat Bournemouth tonight. 
Pep Guardiola and his team have seen a favourable situation unfold over the weekend, with Tottenham and Chelsea dropping points above them. 
The Blues have won their last three in competitions, with the young forward line of Leroy Sane, Raheem Sterling and Gabriel Jesus catching many an eye. 
Eddie Howe's team have not won any of their six matches in 2017 and sit just six points clear of the relegation zone. Their record against City isn't great either, losing all three of their Premier League meetings and conceding 13 goals in the process. 
The game kicks off at 8pm tonight and we'll be with you all evening to bring you team news, match action and all the reaction and analysis afterwards. Which TV channel is Bournemouth vs Man City on? 
Bournemouth vs Manchester City will be shown live on Sky Sports 1 and Sky Sports 1 HD from 7pm on Monday, February 13. 
Kick-off from the Vitality Stadium is at 8pm. 
You can also follow all the action on our live right here. 18:37 Stuart Brennan Close affair 
Following on from my colleague Ciaran Kelly’s post about Eddie Howe’s programme notes, I love the shorthand that Eddie uses. 
He said their games against City have been “challenging” which is a euphemism for “We got leathered every time” - their three meetings since promotion have ended 5-1, 4-0 and 4-0. 
But that kind of run rarely lasts long, especially in the Premier League, and tonight’s affair should be a lot closer given the Cherries’ home record against top clubs this season. 
But City DO play with more freedom away from home, and of they get going they can bury teams in a 20-minute period, as they showed at West Ham and West Brom this season. 18:30 Ciaran Kelly Looks in City's favour 
Bournemouth have a pretty miserable record against Manchester City - conceding 13 goals in their last three league encounters. 
But Cherries boss Eddie Howe will hope his side can summon the spirit that got positive results against both Liverpool and Arsenal here at the compact Vitality Stadium. 
Writing in his programme notes, he said: ‘Matches against Manchester City in our recent history have been challenging but equally we have learnt a great deal from each experience. 
‘Tonight will be another opportunity to see what progress we have made from those previous encounters.’ 18:18 
Gabriel Jesus or Aguero? The debate continues. 18:10 
Looking ahead quickly to Saturday’s FA Cup game the officials have been announced. 
Anthony Taylor is the man who will be reffing. 
He’s the guy who took charge of City’s game against Chelsea when Aguero and Fernandinho were sent off. 
And John Stones thought City were slightly unfairly treated, he said: “I don’t want to say too much and get in trouble for saying things but I think we have ended up on the bad side of what happened.” 18:02
